Line Item Id.description: A unique identifier for the line item. This ID is crucial for specific lookups, detailed checks, and joining with other datasets. It is the primary key for line item analysis.
Line Item Id.dv360_definition: Numeric ID value of the line item. If left blank, a new line item will be created and a unique ID will be assigned. Optionally, when creating new Line Items, you can use a custom identifier for the purpose of assigning TrueView Ad Groups to the new Line Item. The format for a custom identifier is "ext[custom identifier]", for example, ext123. When the file is uploaded and processed, all custom identifiers will be replaced with DBM-assigned IDs and the objects will be associated (for example, Ad Group to Line Item) based on the custom identifiers.

Partner ID.description: The unique identifier for the partner account. This field is used to filter data for a specific partner and for high-level aggregation.

Advertiser Id.description: The unique identifier for the advertiser. It links line items to a specific advertiser, allowing for advertiser-level performance analysis and filtering.

Advertiser Name.description: The name of the advertiser. Useful for quickly identifying the advertiser in reports and analyses without needing to join with other tables.

Campaign Id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign. This field links the line item to its parent campaign, enabling campaign-level analysis.

Campaign Name.description: The name of the campaign. This provides a human-readable identifier for the campaign, which is useful for reporting and analysis.

dv360_link.description: A direct URL to the line item in the DV360 interface. This allows for quick access and verification of the line item's settings.
dv360_link.dv360_definition: Direct URL link to open the entity in DV360 interface for easy navigation.

Io Id.description: The unique identifier for the insertion order. This field links the line item to its parent insertion order, which is essential for budget and flight date analysis.
Io Id.dv360_definition: Numeric ID value of the insertion order. You can specify a custom identifier (for example, "ext[custom IO identifier]") for an insertion order that you are creating at the same time as this line item.

Io Name.description: The name of the Insertion Order. Often contains details about the campaign phase, ad format, or targeting, which can be parsed for deeper analysis.

Type.description: The channel type of the line item. This is a critical field for analysis, used to segment performance by channel (e.g., Video, Display, YouTube, Audio).
Type.dv360_definition:
The type of entry.

Only writable when creating, not editing.

Select one of the following values:

Display
Video
TrueView
Audio
Demand Gen

Subtype.description: The specific format for a given channel, especially for YouTube. For example, for a 'YouTube' type, subtypes could be 'Skippable', 'Non-skippable', 'In-feed', 'Shorts', or 'Bumper'. This is often used for performance analysis of different YouTube ad formats.
Subtype.dv360_definition:
Field required for line items to distinguish between different formats.

Select one of the following values:

Simple
Non Skippable
Action
Reach
View
Audio
Over The Top
Mobile App Install
Mobile App Buying
Simple Over The Top
Non Skippable Over The Top
Reach Over The Top
Target Frequency
Demand Gen


'Action' is not compatible with TrueView line items.

Name.description: The name of the line item. It often contains information about the country, language, or audience being targeted, which can be parsed for detailed analysis.

Status.description: The current status of the line item (e.g., Active, Paused, Draft). This is useful for filtering out inactive line items from performance analysis.
Status.dv360_definition:
The status setting for the entry.Active
Paused
Draft
Archived

Start Date.description: The start date of the line item's flight. It usually inherits the start date from its parent Insertion Order ('Same as Insertion Order'), but can be customized for specific cases.
Start Date.dv360_definition: A timestamp for the flight start date of the entry in the format MM/DD/YYYY or "Same as Insertion Order" to use the same start date as the parent Insertion Order.

End Date.description: The end date of the line item's flight. It usually inherits the end date from its parent Insertion Order ('Same as Insertion Order'), but can be customized for specific situations.
End Date.dv360_definition: A timestamp for the flight end date of the entry in the format MM/DD/YYYY or "Same as Insertion Order" to use the same end date as the parent Insertion Order.

Budget Type.description: Defines how the line item's budget is measured, either by currency ('Amount') or 'Impressions'. 'Unlimited' indicates it draws from the insertion order's budget. This field is a key component for any budget and pacing analysis.
Budget Type.dv360_definition:
Specifies whether the budget is monetarily based or impression-based. If the IO for this entry is enabled for auto-budget allocation, you can set this to 'Automatic' to allow DBM to automatically budget for this entry.Amount
Impressions
Unlimited
Automatic
TrueView Budget

Budget Amount.description: The budget allocated to the line item, corresponding to the 'Budget Type'. For currency-based budgets, this is a float value in the advertiser's currency. This should be reviewed when analyzing budget and pacing.
Budget Amount.dv360_definition: A positive budget amount for the budget type. This could be a simple integer impression value, or a float for a currency amount. Currencies will be shown in the advertiser's currency in standard units (not in 1/1,000,000s of a currency unit). If 'Automatic' budget allocation is set on the entry, you can specify a minimum amount to spend (for example, 'spend at least' this amount).

Pacing.description: The period over which the budget is spent, either 'Daily' or for the entire 'Flight'. This is a critical setting to check for budget and pacing analysis.
Pacing.dv360_definition: The time period used to spend to the pacing amount.TrueView and Demand Gen line items can only be 'Daily' or 'Flight'

Pacing Rate.description: The rate at which the budget is spent. 'ASAP' spends the budget as quickly as possible, 'Even' distributes it evenly, and 'Ahead' spends it faster at the beginning. Important for budget and pacing analysis.
Pacing Rate.dv360_definition:
The rate of pacing for this entry.

Select one of the following values:ASAP
Even
Ahead
TrueView and Demand Gen line items can only be 'ASAP' or 'Even'

Pacing Amount.description: The amount to be spent per the period defined by the 'Pacing' setting. A key field for budget and pacing analysis.
Pacing Amount.dv360_definition: The amount to spend per the time period set by the pacing type.

Frequency Enabled.description: Indicates if frequency capping is enabled. When analyzing frequency caps, this field should be checked along with 'Frequency Exposures', 'Frequency Amount', and 'Frequency Period'.
Frequency Enabled.dv360_definition:
Enables/disables impression-based frequency capping on the line item.

Select one of the following values:TRUE
FALSE

Frequency Exposures.description: The number of impressions allowed per user within the defined frequency cap period.
Frequency Exposures.dv360_definition: A positive integer amount for the number of impressions in a given Frequency Amount, that is, the x in 'Show x impressions over y period'.

Frequency Period.description: The time unit for the frequency cap (e.g., Hours, Days, Weeks).
Frequency Period.dv360_definition:
Specifies the time period unit for the frequency cap.

Select one of the following values:Minutes
Hours
Days
Weeks
Months
For TrueView and Demand Gen line items, supported periods are Days, Weeks, Months.

Frequency Amount.description: The duration of the frequency cap period (e.g., 4 hours, 7 days). This is used in combination with 'Frequency Exposures' and 'Frequency Period'. Note: Not supported for TrueView or Demand Gen line items.
Frequency Amount.dv360_definition:
A positive integer amount for length of time of the Frequency Period type, that is, the y in 'Show x impressions over y period'.This amount is not supported for TrueView or Demand Gen line items.

Frequency cap time periods must be 30 days or less.

TrueView View Frequency Enabled.description: Indicates if view-based frequency capping is enabled, specific to TrueView line items.
TrueView View Frequency Enabled.dv360_definition:
Enables/disables view-based frequency capping on the TrueView line itemTRUE
FALSE

TrueView View Frequency Exposures.description: The number of views allowed per user within the defined frequency cap period for TrueView line items.
TrueView View Frequency Exposures.dv360_definition: A positive integer amount for the number of TrueView views, that is, the x in 'Show x views over the period'

TrueView View Frequency Period.description: The time unit for the view-based frequency cap for TrueView line items (Days, Weeks, or Months).
TrueView View Frequency Period.dv360_definition:
Specifies the time period unit for the TrueView view-based frequency capDays
Weeks
Months

Fees.description: A list of all fees associated with the line item. This field is typically compared with the fees at the IO level, especially for specific formats like Xtra Social. After transformation, the data is parsed from a complex string into a structured list for easier analysis.
Fees.dv360_definition:
All fees for this entry. List format = (Fee category; Fee amount; Fee type; Invoiced;).Fee categoryCPM
Media

Fee amountFloat
Pct as float

Fee type(string, see table in fees)

InvoicedTrue
False
blank

Example '(CPM; 2; Display & Video 360 Fee; False) ; (Media; 13; Default; True);'
Acceptable values are provided in the following table:
Fee categoryFee TypeInvoiced optionCPM/Media Default Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media Third-Party Ad Server Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media DoubleVerify Permitted (True/False) CPM/Media Adsafe Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media Adxpose Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media Vizu Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media Aggregate Knowledge Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media Teracent Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media Evidon Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media Agency Trading Desk Fee Not permitted (leave blank) CPM/Media Adloox Permitted (True/False) CPM ShopLocal Required (True) CPM TrustMetrics Not permitted (leave blank) CPM Integral Ad Science Video Permitted (True/False) CPM MOAT Video Not permitted (leave blank) Media Display & Video 360 Fee Required (True) Media Media Cost Data Not permitted (leave blank) Media Scibids Fee Required (True) 

Note: Adloox was a previous name for the provider now known as Scope3.

Bid Strategy Type.description: The bidding strategy used by the line item, which is related to its objective. It might start as 'Fixed Bid' and later be changed to an optimization strategy like 'Maximize'.
Bid Strategy Type.dv360_definition:
Select one of the applicable bid strategies:Minimize: While spending the full budget, minimize CPA/CPC
Maximize: While spending the full budget, maximize Impression Value or Quality Impression
Beat: Meet or beat a goal of X CPA/CPC
Optimize vCPM: Optimize for viewable CPM bid of X
Fixed: Specify a fixed bid of X

Bid Strategy Value.description: The goal bid value for 'Beat', 'Optimize VCPM', and 'Fixed' bid strategies. This field is not required for 'Minimize' or 'Maximize' strategies.
Bid Strategy Value.dv360_definition:
For Beat, Optimize VCPM, Fixed strategy types, choose a value for the goal bid.
Note that no Bid Strategy Value is required for the Bid Strategy Type 'Minimize' or 'Maximize'

Bid Strategy Unit.description: The unit for the bid strategy, such as CPA, CPC, or AV_VIEWED. This is applicable for 'Beat', 'Minimize', or 'Maximize' strategies.
Bid Strategy Unit.dv360_definition:
For Beat, Minimize or Maximize strategy types, select the corresponding unit:CPA
CPC
custom impr. value/cost
CIVA
IVO_TEN
AV_VIEWED

Bid Strategy Do Not Exceed.description: A maximum CPM value that the bid strategy should not exceed. A value of 0 means this limit is not enabled. Applicable only for 'Minimize', 'Maximize', or 'Beat' strategies.
Bid Strategy Do Not Exceed.dv360_definition: Set a 'do not exceed' CPM value. If 0, 'do not exceed' is not enabled. This is available only if the Bid Strategy is 'Minimize', 'Maximize' or 'Beat'.

Apply Floor Price For Deals.description: Indicates whether to prioritize deals over open auction inventory.
Apply Floor Price For Deals.dv360_definition:
Whether to prioritize deals over open auction inventoryTRUE
FALSE

Creative Assignments.description: A list of creatives assigned to the line item. After transformation, creative IDs are converted into descriptive names that include the creative's review status, allowing for quick assessment of campaign readiness.
Creative Assignments.dv360_definition:
List of Creative IDs to assigned to the entry.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API Creative resource IDs.
List format = (Creative.creativeId; Creative.creativeId; etc.). This list is generated in ascending numerical order.
On upload, users can also include Campaign Manager 360 Placement IDs. Placement IDs should be preceded by the letters 'CM', ex 'CM789'.

Ex. (123;CM789;).
sample_data: FR - CarPromo - Consideration - Native 1200x627_0925_rectangle (APPROVAL_STATUS_PENDING_SERVABLE); FR - CarPromo - Consideration - Native 627x627_0925_square (APPROVAL_STATUS_PENDING_SERVABLE)
NL - Auto Promo - Consideration - Xtra Social 320x480_0925 (APPROVAL_STATUS_PENDING_SERVABLE)
FR - AO HOME - Consideration - Xtra Social 320x480_0825 (APPROVAL_STATUS_PENDING_SERVABLE)

Geography Targeting - Include.description: A list of geographic locations to be included in targeting. After transformation, location IDs (e.g., '2056') are converted to human-readable names (e.g., 'France').
Geography Targeting - Include.dv360_definition:
List of geographies to include in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API TargetingOption resource IDs for targeting type TARGETING_TYPE_GEO_REGION.
List format = (TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; etc.). This list is generated in ascending numerical order.
sample_data: Antwerp, Flanders, Belgium; East Flanders, Flanders, Belgium

Geography Targeting - Exclude.description: A list of geographic locations to be excluded from targeting. After transformation, location IDs are converted to human-readable names.
Geography Targeting - Exclude.dv360_definition:
List of geographies to exclude in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API TargetingOption resource IDs for targeting type TARGETING_TYPE_GEO_REGION.
List format = (TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; etc.). This list is generated in ascending numerical order.
sample_data: Austria; France; India; Italy; Spain; Turkiye; United Kingdom
Austria; France; India; Italy; Spain; Turkiye; United Kingdom; Antwerp, Flanders, Belgium; East Flanders, Flanders, Belgium
Austria; France; India; Spain; Turkiye; United Kingdom

Geography Regional Location List Targeti.description: A list of regional location list IDs to be included in targeting.
Geography Regional Location List Targeti.dv360_definition: List of geo regional location list ids to include. List format = (11; 22; 33;).

Geography Regional Location List Targeti.description: A list of regional location list IDs to be excluded from targeting.
Geography Regional Location List Targeti.dv360_definition: List of geo regional location list ids to exclude. List format = (11; 22; 33;).

Proximity Targeting.description: Defines proximity targeting using latitude, longitude, and radius.
Proximity Targeting.dv360_definition: List of proximity targets each in the format "(Latitude; Longitude; Radius; Unit; FullAddress;);". Latitude is between -90 and 90 degrees (inclusive); Longitude is between -180 and 180 degrees (inclusive); Radius is a distance between 1 and 500 (inclusive) in Unit; Unit can be "mi" or "km"; FullAddress is optional. For example: "(38.907192; -77.03687; 1.0; mi; Washington D.C., DC, USA;); (40.712775; -74.005972; 20.5; km; 40.712775, -74.005972;); (20.000234; -56.675423; 5.0; mi; ;);".

Proximity Location List Targeting.description: A list of proximity location lists to be targeted.
Proximity Location List Targeting.dv360_definition: List of proximity list targets for insertion orders or Non-TrueView line items, each in the format "(ProximityListId; Radius; Unit; );". ProximityListId is a location list id under an advertiser's resources. Radius is a distance between 1 and 500 (inclusive) in Unit; Unit can be "mi" or "km"; There is a limit of targeting two location lists per entity along with Geography Regional Location Lists. For example: "(10041691678; 20.0; mi;); (10038858567; 20.5; km;);".

Language Targeting - Include.description: A list of languages to include in targeting. After transformation, language codes are converted to human-readable names.
Language Targeting - Include.dv360_definition:
List of languages to include in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API TargetingOption resource IDs for targeting type TARGETING_TYPE_LANGUAGE.
List format = (TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; etc.). This list is generated in ascending numerical order.

Language Targeting - Exclude.description: A list of languages to exclude from targeting. After transformation, language codes are converted to human-readable names.
Language Targeting - Exclude.dv360_definition:
List of languages to exclude in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API TargetingOption resource IDs for targeting type TARGETING_TYPE_LANGUAGE.
List format = (TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; etc.). This list is generated in ascending numerical order.

Device Targeting - Include.description: A list of device types to include in targeting (e.g., Computer, Smart_phone, Tablet). After transformation, device codes are converted to human-readable names.
Device Targeting - Include.dv360_definition:
List of devices to include in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API TargetingOption resource IDs for the following targeting types:
TARGETING_TYPE_DEVICE_TYPE
TARGETING_TYPE_DEVICE_MAKE_MODEL
TARGETING_TYPE_OPERATING_SYSTEM

Device Targeting - Exclude.dv360_definition:
List of devices to exclude in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API TargetingOption resource IDs for the following targeting types:
TARGETING_TYPE_DEVICE_TYPE
TARGETING_TYPE_DEVICE_MAKE_MODEL
TARGETING_TYPE_OPERATING_SYSTEM
List format = (TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; etc.). This list is generated in ascending numerical order.

Browser Targeting - Include.description: A list of browsers to include in targeting. After transformation, browser IDs are converted to human-readable names.
Browser Targeting - Include.dv360_definition:
List of browsers to include in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API TargetingOption resource IDs for targeting type TARGETING_TYPE_BROWSER.
List format = (TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; etc.). This list is generated in ascending numerical order.

Browser Targeting - Exclude.description: A list of browsers to exclude from targeting. After transformation, browser IDs are converted to human-readable names.
Browser Targeting - Exclude.dv360_definition:
List of browsers to exclude in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API TargetingOption resource IDs for targeting type TARGETING_TYPE_BROWSER.
List format = (TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; TargetingOption.targetingOptionId; etc.). This list is generated in ascending numerical order.

List of the digital content labels to exclude. List format = (G;PG; etc.).G
PG

Choose the sensitivity setting to block inventory based on the subject matter of its surrounding content.Do not block
Use Campaign Manager 360 Verification

Channel Targeting - Include.description: A list of channel names (whitelists) to include in targeting. These are pre-defined collections of sites or apps.
Channel Targeting - Include.dv360_definition:
List of channels to include in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API Channel resource IDs.
List format = (Channel.channelId; Channel.channelId; etc.).

Channel Targeting - Exclude.description: A list of channel names (blacklists) to exclude from targeting. Common exclusions include low-quality sites, dictionaries, games, low CTR sites, and low viewability placements.
Channel Targeting - Exclude.dv360_definition:
List of channels to exclude in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API Channel resource IDs.
List format = (Channel.channelId; Channel.channelId; etc.).

App Targeting - Include.description: A list of specific mobile apps to include in targeting. After transformation, app IDs are converted to readable app identifiers with platform prefixes.
App Targeting - Include.dv360_definition:
List of apps to include in targeting. The list is concatenated strings of app platform and app platform ID.
The following values are used to define the app platform:
APP (This encompasses both Android Play store and Apple App store platforms)
ROKU_APP
AMAZON_FIRETV_APP
XBOX_APP
PLAYSTATION_APP
APPLE_TV_APP
SAMSUNG_TV_APP
ANDROID_TV_APP
GENERIC_CTV_APP
LG_TV_APP
VIZIO_TV_APP
The ID is provided by the relevant platform, such as a bundle ID from Android's Play store (example: com.google.android.gm) or a App ID from Apple's App store (example: 422689480).The concatenated string of app platform and ID is separated by a colon, for example: APP:com.google.android.gm.
List format = (APP:com.google.android.gm; APP:422689480; etc.). This list is generated in ascending alphabetical order.

Audience Targeting - Include.description: Transforms cryptic audience targeting ID strings like "(1234567;30;)" into readable audience information like "(Young Adults 18-34;30;)" showing the actual audience name with recency settings.
Audience Targeting - Include.dv360_definition:
List of audience lists to include in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API FirstPartyAndPartnerAudience resource IDs.
For first-party audience lists, each audience is listed as a pair of FirstPartyAndPartnerAudience.firstPartyAndPartnerAudienceId and recency setting. A pair is (1;1d;), where 1d is a sample recency representing 1 day recency. Recency is not available for third-party audiences, so the list format is (3;);(4;);. To "AND" and "OR" groups of audiences, follow this example: To combine pairs with and without recency: '((1;1d;);(2;365d;));((3;);(4;5m;);(5;all;));'. This means (list 1 with 1 day recency OR list 2 with 365day recency ) AND (list 3 without a specified recency OR list 4 with 5 minute recency OR list 5 with all users).

all

Daypart Targeting.description: Specifies which days and times the line item should run. Useful for targeting specific time windows.
Daypart Targeting.dv360_definition:
List of IDs, where each daypart ID is constructed in the following format:
daypart_id = base_dayparting_id
+ days_since_monday * 10000
+ start * 100
+ end

base_dayparting_id = 300000
days_since_monday: 0=Monday, 1=Tuesday, ..., 6=Sunday
start: 0..95 (00:00--23:45) an integer from 0-95, representing 15min slots
end: 1..96 (00:15--24:00); an integer from 0-95, representing 15min slots
start < end
For new entities, times will be set in the timezone of your users(i.e., "Local"). For existing entities, the timezone will not be changed.
This list is generated in ascending numerical order.

Markup.description: The markup percentage or amount applied to media costs. This is equivalent to 'Partner Revenue Amount' and represents the agency fee or margin.

markup refers to the percentage increase added to media cost 
to calculate the final price charged to a client.

Partner Revenue Amount.description: The revenue amount or percentage (markup) charged to the client on top of media costs. This field should be referenced when analyzing profitability or when users ask about 'markup'.
Partner Revenue Amount.dv360_definition: A positive float value corresponding to the Partner Revenue Model. Only applicable when column Partner Revenue Model is specified.

Timestamp.description: The last modified timestamp for the line item. Used for versioning and tracking when changes were made to the configuration.
Timestamp.dv360_definition:
The timestamp for the entry.For non-Demand Gen line items, this is a "last modified" timestamp used by the system to verify that the entry has not changed between downloading and uploading.
For Demand Gen line items, this is timestamp of the file generation and is used to verify that the line item was downloaded recently, but does not guarantee that the line item has not been updated since the initial download.

Io Id.description: The unique identifier for the insertion order. This ID is crucial for linking line items to their parent insertion order and for budget analysis.
Io Id.dv360_definition: Numeric ID value of the insertion order. If left blank, a new Insertion Order ID will be created and a unique ID will be assigned. Optionally, when creating a new Insertion Order, you can use a custom identifier for the purpose of assigning Line Items to the new Insertion Order. The format for a custom identifier is "ext[custom identifier]", for example, ext123. When the file is uploaded and processed, all custom identifiers will be replaced with DBM-assigned IDs and the objects will be associated (for example, Line Item to Insertion Order) based on the custom identifiers.

Partner ID.description: The unique identifier for the partner account. This field is used to filter data for a specific partner and for high-level aggregation.

Advertiser Id.description: The unique identifier for the advertiser associated with this insertion order. Links IOs to specific advertisers for analysis.

Advertiser Name.description: The name of the advertiser. Useful for quickly identifying the advertiser in reports without needing to join with other tables.

Campaign Id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign associated with this insertion order. Links IOs to their parent campaigns.
Campaign Id.dv360_definition: Numeric ID value of the campaign. You can specify a custom identifier (for example, "ext[custom campaign identifier]") for a campaign that you are creating at the same time as this insertion order.

Campaign Name.description: The name of the campaign. Provides a human-readable identifier for the campaign in reporting and analysis.

dv360_link.dv360_definition: Direct URL link to open the entity in DV360 interface for easy navigation.

Integration Code.description: An optional tracking code for integration with external systems or for custom tracking purposes.

Pacing.description: The period over which the IO's budget is spent: 'Daily', 'Monthly', or 'Flight'. Critical for budget and pacing analysis.
Pacing.dv360_definition:
The time period used to spend to the pacing amount.Daily
Monthly
Flight

Pacing Rate.description: The rate at which the budget is spent. 'ASAP' spends budget quickly, 'Even' distributes evenly, 'Ahead' front-loads spending. Note: 'ASAP' is not compatible with 'Flight' pacing.
Pacing Rate.dv360_definition:
The rate of pacing for this entry.ASAP
Even
Ahead

'ASAP' is not compatible with 'Flight' pacing.

Pacing Amount.description: The amount to be spent per the period defined by the 'Pacing' setting. A key field for budget and pacing analysis.
Pacing Amount.dv360_definition: The amount to spend per the time period set by the pacing type.

Frequency Enabled.description: Indicates if frequency capping is enabled at the IO level. When analyzing frequency caps, check this along with 'Frequency Exposures', 'Frequency Amount', and 'Frequency Period'.
Frequency Enabled.dv360_definition:
Enables/disables impression-based frequency capping on the insertion order.TRUE
FALSE

Frequency Exposures.description: The number of impressions allowed per user within the defined frequency cap period.
Frequency Exposures.dv360_definition: A positive integer amount for the number of impressions in a given Frequency Amount, that is, the x in 'Show x impressions over y period'.

Frequency Period.description: The time unit for the frequency cap (Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, or Months).
Frequency Period.dv360_definition:
Specifies the time period unit for the frequency cap.Minutes
Hours
Days
Weeks
Months

Frequency Amount.description: The duration of the frequency cap period. Typically 6 exposures per month for Display, 3 exposures per month for Video/Audio/YouTube. Frequency cap periods must be 30 days or less.
Frequency Amount.dv360_definition:
A positive integer amount for length of time of the Frequency Period type, that is, the y in 'Show x impressions over y period'.

Frequency cap time periods must be 30 days or less.

Kpi Value.description: The target value for the KPI. For example, if KPI Type is 'CPA', this might be '30' (representing €30). Can be currency, percentage, or unitless depending on KPI Type.

Budget Type.description: Defines how the IO's budget is measured: 'Amount' (currency-based) or 'Impressions' (volume-based). Key component for budget analysis.

Specifies the type of budget in terms of an amount of "revenue" to spend (amount) or a number of impressions (impressions) to purchase.Amount
Impressions

Budget Segments.description: Detailed breakdown of budget allocation by time period. Each segment includes budget amount, start date, end date, and optional description. Useful for analyzing budget pacing over time.
Budget Segments.dv360_definition: Specifies the specific budget segments. List format = (Budget, Start Date, End Date, Campaign Budget ID, Description). Budget is in currency floating format. Dates are in MM/DD/YYYY format. Campaign Budget ID is empty if not specified. Description cannot be empty for any budget segments. If an existing budget segment has an empty description, a description will need to be provided for the row to be uploaded. Example: "(100.50;01/01/2016;03/31/2016;12345;budget segment 1;);(200.00;04/01/2016;06/30/2016;;updated budget segment 1;);"

Total Budget Segment.description: A summary combining all budget segments, showing the total amount and the full period from the earliest start date to the latest end date. Provides a quick overview of total IO budget and flight dates.
Total Budget Segment.dv360_definition:
The Total Budget Segment represents the aggregated budget information across all individual budget segments. It includes:
Total Amount: The sum of all segment budgets.
Total Period: The full time span covered by the segments, starting from the earliest segment start date to the latest segment end date.example :  "Budget Segments": "(109.08; 03/01/2025; 03/31/2025; ; ;); (115.12; 04/01/2025; 04/30/2025; ; ;); (160.0; 05/01/2025; 05/31/2025; ; ;); (160.0; 06/01/2025; 06/30/2025; ; ;); (150.95; 07/01/2025; 07/31/2025; ; ;);",
  "Total Budget Segment": "695.15; 03/01/2025; 07/31/2025",

List of apps to include in targeting. The list is concatenated strings of app platform and app platform ID.

APP (This encompasses both Android Play store and Apple App store platforms)
ROKU_APP

XBOX_APP
PLAYSTATION_APP
APPLE_TV_APP

The ID is provided by the relevant platform, such as a bundle ID from Android's Play store (example: com.google.android.gm) or a App ID from Apple's App store (example: 422689480).The concatenated string of app platform and ID is separated by a colon, for example: APP:com.google.android.gm.

Audience Targeting - Include.description: A list of audience names to include in targeting. After transformation, audience IDs are converted to readable names with recency settings.
Audience Targeting - Include.dv360_definition:
List of audience lists to include in targeting.
This column uses Display & Video 360 API FirstPartyAndPartnerAudience resource IDs.
For first-party audience lists, each audience is listed as a pair of FirstPartyAndPartnerAudience.firstPartyAndPartnerAudienceId and recency setting. A pair is (1;1d;), where 1d is a sample recency representing 1 day recency. Recency is not available for third-party audiences, so the list format is (3;);(4;);. To "AND" and "OR" groups of audiences, follow this example: To combine pairs with and without recency: '((1;1d;);(2;365d;));((3;);(4;5m;);(5;all;));'. This means (list 1 with 1 day recency OR list 2 with 365day recency ) AND (list 3 without a specified recency OR list 4 with 5 minute recency OR list 5 with all users).
Valid recency values are:
all
1m

Daypart Targeting.description: Specifies which days and times the IO should run. Uses encoded IDs representing specific time slots. Useful for targeting specific time windows.
Daypart Targeting.dv360_definition:
List of IDs, where each daypart ID is constructed in the following format:
daypart_id = base_dayparting_id
+ days_since_monday * 10000
+ start * 100
+ end

base_dayparting_id = 300000
days_since_monday: 0=Monday, 1=Tuesday, ..., 6=Sunday
start: 0..95 (00:00--23:45) an integer from 0-95, representing 15min slots
end: 1..96 (00:15--24:00); an integer from 0-95, representing 15min slots
start < end
For new entities, times will be set in the timezone of your users(i.e., "Local"). For existing entities, the timezone will not be changed.
This list is generated in ascending numerical order.

Daypart Targeting Time Zone.dv360_definition:

Example 1: to target 18-55 and include unknown ages, specify the format {From; To ; Include unknown True/False} = 18;55;true;
Example 2: to target only users >35 years old and exclude unknown ages, specify the following = 35;+;false;.

Demographic Targeting Household Income.description: Targets households based on income percentile (Top 10%, 11-20%, etc.). Useful for premium product campaigns.
Demographic Targeting Household Income.dv360_definition:
Target a household income range. Specify a from/to range by selecting a single Top_of_Range income range and a single Bottom_of_Range income range and whether to include households with unknown income true/false. See the list of acceptable Top_of_Range/Bottom_of_Range ranges.
Example 1: to target the top 10% to 50% of households and include households with unknown income, specify the format {Top_of_Range; Bottom_of_Range; Include unknown True/False} = Top 10%;41-50%;true;
Example 2: to target only the lower 50% of households and exclude households with unknown income, specify the format {Top_of_Range; Bottom_of_Range; Include unknown True/False} = Lower 50%;Lower 50%;true;

Insertion Order Optimization.description: Indicates whether insertion order-level optimization is enabled, allowing DV360 to optimize performance across all line items within the IO.

Bid Strategy Unit.description: The unit for the bid strategy optimization: CPA, CPC, custom impression value/cost, CIVA, IVO_TEN, or AV_VIEWED.
Bid Strategy Unit.dv360_definition:
Select bid strategy unit to optimize bidding:CPA
CPC
custom impr. value/cost
CIVA
IVO_TEN
AV_VIEWED

Bid Strategy Do Not Exceed.description: A maximum CPM value that the bid strategy should not exceed. A value of 0 means this limit is not enabled.
Bid Strategy Do Not Exceed.dv360_definition: Set a 'do not exceed' CPM value. If 0, 'do not exceed' is not enabled.

Campaign Id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign. This ID is crucial for linking insertion orders and line items to their parent campaign.
Campaign Id.dv360_definition: Numeric ID value of the campaign. If left blank, a new Campaign ID will be created and a unique ID will be assigned. Optionally, when creating a new Campaign, you can use a custom identifier for the purpose of assigning Insertion Orders to the new Campaign. The format for a custom identifier is "ext[custom identifier]", for example, ext123. When the file is uploaded and processed, all custom identifiers will be replaced with DBM-assigned IDs and the objects will be associated (for example, Insertion Order to Campaign) based on the custom identifiers.

Partner ID.description: The unique identifier for the partner account. This field is used to filter data for a specific partner.

Advertiser ID.description: The unique identifier for the advertiser. Links campaigns to specific advertisers for analysis.
Advertiser ID.dv360_definition: Numeric ID value of the advertiser. It must be a valid existing advertiser ID

Advertiser Id.description: The unique identifier for the advertiser. Links campaigns to specific advertisers for analysis.
Advertiser Id.dv360_definition: Numeric ID value of the advertiser. It must be a valid existing advertiser ID

Advertiser Name.description: The name of the advertiser. Useful for quickly identifying the advertiser in reports without needing to join with other tables.

Name.description: The name of the campaign. This provides a human-readable identifier for the campaign used in reporting and analysis.

dv360_link.description: A direct URL to the campaign in the DV360 interface. This allows for quick access and verification of the campaign's settings.
dv360_link.dv360_definition: Direct URL link to open the entity in DV360 interface for easy navigation.

Timestamp.description: The last modified timestamp for the campaign. Used for versioning and tracking when changes were made to the configuration.
Timestamp.dv360_definition: The timestamp for the entry, this is used by the system to verify that the entry has not changed between downloading and uploading.

Status.description: The current status of the campaign (e.g., Active, Paused, Archived). This is useful for filtering out inactive campaigns from analysis.
Status.dv360_definition:
The status setting for the entry.Active
Paused
Archived

Campaign Goal.description: The primary goal of the campaign: 'Raise awareness of my brand or product', 'Drive online action or visits', 'Drive offline or in-store sales', or 'Drive app installs or engagements'.
Campaign Goal.dv360_definition:
Select one of the applicable campaign goals:Raise awareness of my brand or product
Drive online action or visits
Drive offline or in-store sales
Drive app installs or engagements
sample_data: Raise awareness of my brand or product

Campaign Goal KPI.description: The KPI unit being measured for this campaign goal (e.g., CPM, Viewable %, CPIAVC, CPA, CPC, CTR, Other).
Campaign Goal KPI.dv360_definition:
Select one of the applicable campaign goal KPI:CPM
Viewable %
CPIAVC
CPA
CPC
CTR

Campaign Goal KPI Value.description: The target value for the campaign KPI. For example, CTR: 0.20%, CPA: 30€, CPM: 5€. For 'Viewable %' and 'CTR', enter as percentage (e.g., 80% = 80).
Campaign Goal KPI Value.dv360_definition: A positive number for campaign goal KPI. For campaign goal KPI 'Viewable %' and 'CTR' enter the value for this field in percentage, e.g. 80% would be entered as '80'. For KPI 'Other', this field is a short description of objective.

Creative Types.description: The types of creatives expected to be used in the campaign: Display, Video, and/or Audio. Can include multiple types.

List of creative types you expect to use.Display
Video
Audio

Campaign Budget.description: The total monetary budget allocated to the campaign. Always a currency amount in the advertiser's currency.
Campaign Budget.dv360_definition: A positive budget amount for the campaign. It is always a float for a currency amount since it will be always monetary budget. Currencies will be shown in the advertiser's currency in standard units (not in 1/1,000,000s of a currency unit)

Campaign Start Date.description: The start date and time of the campaign in MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm format.
Campaign Start Date.dv360_definition: The start date of the campaign in the format MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm

Campaign End Date.description: The end date and time of the campaign in MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm format. Often left open-ended (no end date set).
Campaign End Date.dv360_definition: The end date of the campaign in the format MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm

Frequency Enabled.description: Indicates if frequency capping is enabled at the campaign level. When analyzing frequency caps, check this along with 'Frequency Exposures', 'Frequency Amount', and 'Frequency Period'.
Frequency Enabled.dv360_definition:
Enables/disables impression-based frequency capping on the campaign.TRUE
FALSE

Frequency Exposures.description: The number of impressions allowed per user within the defined frequency cap period.
Frequency Exposures.dv360_definition: A positive integer amount for the number of impressions in a given Frequency Amount, that is, the x in 'Show x impressions over y period'.

Frequency Period.description: The time unit for the frequency cap (Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, or Months).
Frequency Period.dv360_definition:
Specifies the time period unit for the frequency cap.Minutes
Hours
Days
Weeks
Months

Frequency Amount.description: The duration of the frequency cap period. Typically 6 exposures per month. Frequency cap periods must be 30 days or less.
Frequency Amount.dv360_definition:
A positive integer amount for length of time of the Frequency Period type, that is, the y in 'Show x impressions over y period'.

Frequency cap time periods must be 30 days or less.

Campaign Budget Segments.description: Detailed breakdown of campaign budget allocation by segments. Can include Mediaocean integration details with Prisma codes for billing and invoice tracking.
Campaign Budget Segments.dv360_definition:
The set of budget segments for the campaign. List format = (ID; Name; Type; Amount; Start Date; End Date; External Budget Source; External Budget ID; Invoice Grouping ID; Prisma Client Code; Prisma Product Code; Prisma Estimate Code; Prisma Type; Supplier;).Example '(; My Budget; IMPRESSIONS; 234; 01/01/2020 00:00; ; MEDIA_OCEAN; ExternalId; InvoiceId; Client; Product; Estimate; DISPLAY; MySupplier;)' Where ID and End Date are not provided.
Acceptable values are provided in the following table:
Column NameRequiredDescriptionID No The unique ID of the campaign budget segment. This must be provided when editing a budget segment. If left blank, the budget segment will be written as new. Name Yes The display name of the campaign budget segment. Type Yes The type of the budget amount. Acceptable values are:Amount
Impressions
 Amount Yes A positive budget amount for the budget type. This could be a simple integer impression value, or a float for a currency amount. Currencies will be shown in the advertiser's currency in standard units (not in 1/1,000,000s of a currency unit). Start Date No A timestamp for the flight start date of the budget segment in the format MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm. An unset start date is represented by a blank field value. End Date No A timestamp for the flight end date of the budget segment in the format MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm. An unset end date is represented by a blank field value. External Budget Source Yes The source of the budget segment. Acceptable values are:None
Mediaocean
 External Budget ID Only for Mediaocean budget segments If set, all impressions served against this budget segment will include this ID on the invoice if the customer has opted into budget-segment-level billing. Invoice Grouping ID No If set, all budget segments with the same External Budget ID and Invoice Grouping ID will be aggregated into a single invoice if the customer has opted into budget-segment-level billing. Prisma Client Code Only for Mediaocean budget segments Can only be set for Mediaocean budget segments. Google Payments Center supports searching and filtering on this field. Prisma Product Code Only for Mediaocean budget segments Can only be set for Mediaocean budget segments. Google Payments Center supports searching and filtering on this field. Prisma Estimate Code Only for Mediaocean budget segments Can only be set for Mediaocean budget segments. Google Payments Center supports searching and filtering on this field. Prisma Type Only for Mediaocean budget segments Can only be set for Mediaocean budget segments. The Prisma type of the segment. Acceptable values are:Display
Search
Video
Audio
Social
Fee
 Prisma Supplier Only for Mediaocean budget segments Can only be set for Mediaocean budget segments. The entity allocated to this budget (DSP, site, etc.)

Demographic Targeting Age.description: Targets specific age ranges at campaign level (e.g., 18-25, 45+). Important for demographic segmentation.

Example 1: to target 18-55 and include unknown ages, specify the format {From; To ; Include unknown True/False} = 18;55;true;
Example 2: to target only users >35 years old and exclude unknown ages, specify the following = 35;+;false;.

Demographic Targeting Household Income.description: Targets households based on income percentile at campaign level (Top 10%, 11-20%, etc.).
Demographic Targeting Household Income.dv360_definition:
Target a household income range. Specify a from/to range by selecting a single Top_of_Range income range and a single Bottom_of_Range income range and whether to include households with unknown income true/false. See the list of acceptable Top_of_Range/Bottom_of_Range ranges.
Example 1: to target the top 10% to 50% of households and include households with unknown income, specify the format {Top_of_Range; Bottom_of_Range; Include unknown True/False} = Top 10%;41-50%;true;
Example 2: to target only the lower 50% of households and exclude households with unknown income, specify the format {Top_of_Range; Bottom_of_Range; Include unknown True/False} = Lower 50%;Lower 50%;true;
